resources.string: 1. Do you own or regularly use a car?
2. What type of car do you drive?
3. How many kilometers/miles do you drive per year?
4. How often do you use public transportation (bus, train, subway)?
5. How much time do you spend on public transport per week (bus, train, subway)?
6. How many short-haul flights (less than 1,500 km / 932 miles) have you taken in the past year?
7. How many long-haul flights (less than 1,500 km / 932 miles) have you taken in the past year?
9. How often do you eat the following animal-based products?
10. How often do you waste food or throw away uneaten leftovers?
11. What type of home do you live in?
12. How many people live in your household?
13. What is the size of your home?
14. What type of energy do you use to heat your home?
15. What is your average monthly electricity bill?
16. What type of energy do you use to heat water in your home?
17. Do you use any renewable energy sources for electricity or heating (e.g., solar, wind)?
18. How often do you buy new clothes?
19. Do you buy second-hand or eco-friendly products?
20. How many electronic devices (phones, laptops, etc.) have you purchased in the past year?
Meat-based\n(eat all types of animal products)
Yes, primarily (more than 50% of energy use)
Yes, partially (less than 50% of energy use)
You have completed %1$d times during the past week
I have done this habit for the day

Carbon footprint is the total amount of greenhouse gases, especially carbon dioxide (CO₂), emitted directly or indirectly by one\'s activities. These emissions contribute to climate change and are measured in tons of CO₂ equivalents.
Greenhouse gases trap heat in the atmosphere, causing global warming, extreme weather events and also lead to environmental degradation such as rising sea levels, habitat loss.
Emissions from fossil fuels release pollutants harmful to health, causing respiratory and cardiovascular issues.
Climate-related disasters burden global economies, especially in regions less able to recover.
Vulnerable communities face the harshest impacts of climate change.

By making sustainable choices like using renewable energy, reducing waste, and supporting environmental policies, you can play a crucial role in combating climate change and creating a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.
You\'re about to fill a one-time questionnaires to calculate your annual carbon footprints.
